title: swaping top menu
content:
I have a problem with Thunderbird (supernova) version on windows 10. I have the latest version 115.3.0 . Ever sense upgrading to the supernova version my menu bar with Get Messages, Address Book, Write have been on top of my page. With menu bar with File, Edit view, Go etc. below it on the second line. Now prior to going to the supernova version, those menu bars were switched. My laptop which is a windows 8.1 version has Thunderbird version 102.15.1 at the present time and it still shows the menu tool bars in the correct position with the Menu File, Edit, View etc. on top. But there is an update to 115.3.0 pending, which I am hesitant to do because of the problem above.

My question: Is there a way, after switching to the supernova version 115.3.0, to switch those menu bars back?

title: SPAM Email Folder
content: The emails in the spam folder fail to delete after the desired expiration date. Alternatively, I have changed the Retention Policy properties on the folder to deselect the 'Use my account settings and selected 'Delete messages more than x days' Still doesn't work. I have also repaired the folder but regardless nothing works. I have used SpamAssassin and SpamPal as the preferred program and that makes no difference. Any solution?

title: Removing old emails from 'To' options
content:
I'm using Thunderbird. Select 'Write' to create a new email A window opens ... and the cursor by default is in 'To' field

I start typing the first few letters of my name and it brings up several 'old' email addresses, and these appear in the list before my new current address. Frequently I end up using wrong email address.

Is there a way to remove these 'old' options.

ON other mail programs there is the option to 'right-click' and remove entries from history

title: Migrating Thunderbird 115
content:
Thunderbird 115 can not be migrated to another computer. Only it can be upgraded. I've tried everything they describe here. The router, the antivirus, to enter the accounts from another email client, etc. And I get the same error with all of my accounts:

Non-overridable TLS error occurred. Handshake error or probably the TLS version or certificate used by the server is incompatible.

With the version 102, there was not this problem when migrating.

title: lost address book downgraded from 115 to 102
content:
Hi, I stupidly 'upgraded' from V102 to V115, which I immediately disliked. I managed to re-install V102, but it then said the profile was for a newer version. I had a backup from a few weeks ago, and copied all the top-level files over. So I got all my setup bacvk and all seemsed fine, but have just seen that my address book is messed up.

I had lots of important 'contact lists' (about 10), they have all disappeared. I only see "Outlook Express..." (imported ages ago) and "Collected Addresses", the main section, and the sub-lists are all missing, and I have lost years of addresses for my business.

I have the abook.sqlite backed up on 13th Sept, but can't open or use it to check what's in there. I tried importing, but got as 'fail'

title: Unable to downgrade Thunderbird after failed TB Supernova installation
content:
Hello, I have many email accounts,Win10 64 bit. I made a backup copy of my default profile and then I upgraded to Supernova, the upgrade seemed succesful, but one of my POP accounts was never polled when downolading emails, Thunderbird skipped retrieving emails from that account. So I downgraded to 102.15.1 64 bit. But it says that the default profile could not be used because a newer version of TB could have modified it, so it forced me to create a new profile. But in the new profile I lost almost everything: sent emails, received emails, filters, archives. The only thing good is that TB 102 remembers the name of mail servers, so I did not have to configure them again. But I had to download again from the server some 6000 emails (I leave the emails on POP servers for some months, for security reasons), but I lost all sent emails and more. So my old, default profile is useless. What to do?

If I try to import it in Supernova it gets error: Uncaught (in promise) NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND: Component returned failure code: 0x80520012 (NS_ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) [nsIFile.copyTo] 

   _recursivelyCopyMsgFolder resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:659    _importMailMessages resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:588    _importServersAndAccounts resource:///modules/ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:248

2 ThunderbirdProfileImporter.jsm:659
creator: a.colamartino

title: Closing TB115 Mac OS not possible with CMD-Q on Mac
content:

How can I change this back to CMD-Q.

PS: When using CMD-TAB to navigate between running apps it is possible to use CMD-Q to quit. However when TB is the active window it does not work...

Any ideas?

Many Thanks!
creator: Daantje

title: TB 115 add-ons
content:
TB 115 has a lot to like - so much that I immediately added another contribution. Then I noticed that there was no HTML tab in the composition window, so no chance to fix broken HTML (from copied source).

I'm pretty sure that facility was not native, but came from the ThunderHTMLedit add-on -- but there seem to be NO add-ons. So I came looking for "115 add-ons", and the first hit is the [| TB 115 FAQ] -- but it says nothing about add-ons!

IAC, a search for ThunderHTMLedit returns nothing, so that great add-on may be gone anyway, but what is happening with TB 115 and add-ons generally (and why does "115 add-ons" get a hit on the FAQ when the FAQ is silent on add-ons)?

[As much as I like TB 115, this may send me back to 102.]

creator: becbecbec

title: Gmail OAuth fails
content:
I've had the same setup of my gmail accounts for years in Thunderbird, but today one of them stopped working.

Whenever I try to get or send mail, I get the pop-up OAuth window for logging into Google. I do so successfully and select "allow" to give access to Thunderbird. But then, back in Thunderbird, I see "Host contacted, sending login information..." and it never finishes. Eventually (many minutes) it times out. I have tried dozens of times with the same result.

I have a second gmail account configured in the same instance of Thunderbird, with exactly the same settings. It continues to work fine, and does not display the OAuth pop-up when I get/send mail. This makes me think that the problem has something to do with my Google account rather than with my Thunderbird settings, but I have not changed anything there either.

Both accounts are configured for pop3 (pop.gmail.com:995), security SSL/TLS, authentication OAuth2. Thunderbird is set to accept all cookies and keep until expired. I deleted all saved passwords for the failing account, but Thunderbird still has the password for the account that is working.

I've already wasted many hours on this. I have read and tried all suggestions that I can find online. Please help!
creator: larry9850

creator: bilyo41

title: Each update causes problems
content:
It seems with recent updates, things no longer work as it used to. I am currently using 115.3.0, build ID 20230926115257 on Debian Linux.

It used to be that if you selected the view as "Unread", it would stick with that folder, now it just does it until you leave the folder.

I normally view messages as text since html can be a security issue. There is a button marked "Show HTML", which no longer works. Now I have to select "View", "Message Body as" and then manually select things back and forth.

I used to be able to have a button for the Filter Function to have filter folder or filter message, not it is only a selection for Filter Functions and then I can select what I want to do. This is going backwards.

Under "Unread Folders", often the count is incorrect and it claims that there is a message which is unread, which is false. If I select "Compact View", and then unselect it, the count gets corrected.

There are also other issues which were caused by updates. There is clearly an issue with regards with a lack of testing to ensure things are not getting broken.
creator: k+firefoxzz

title: Is there a way to use the fields of the email index in a search query?
content:
I keep on hitting the search limitations. I am an IT pro and I know how it works. But it seems there is no UI to access that level of detail.

I try to use open source as much as I can. So on my private PC I use Thunderbird instead of Outlook which is on my work PC. But my case is very peculiar, I collected 12 email addresses over many years around the globe. And searching in this mess is the challenge!

So not being able to name the fields in the search query severely limits the possibility to find things in the 14 year backlog over 12 email accounts ;)

I am worried that fixing this might go too deep under the hood to be a reasonable feature request for this project.

Any ideas?

Because Outlook is not much fun either :(
